title: Can I run 47 Ohm headphones without an amplifier? - Quora

response.answer_text: Usually headphone and earphone has 32ohms drivers/speaker. Now mobile phone's 3.5mm output signal is somewhat less powerful than a laptop or desktop 3.5mm audio out. So you might need a preamplifier device, example NE5534 amplifier, (with a 9v supply, usually) if you use 47ohm driver with your mobile phone. If you use those speakers with laptop, you may not require any preamplifier. There are a many preamplifier designs over the Google.

Yess surely you can drive with ur smartphones... But there will be some slack soft muffled sound from ur smartphone or ipod. Connect it to a laptop to get its best output .If u want max output from jolly good audio technicas ,try using amplifier but i think it may kill the portability pro. I think senhiessers HD 461 can go with your ipod or smarthphone.Good luck!
